<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_linux_bus_finish:
```c
void metal_linux_bus_finish(void)
{
	struct linux_bus *lbus;
	struct metal_bus *bus;

	for_each_linux_bus(lbus) {
		if (metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) == 0)
			metal_bus_unregister(bus);
	}
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_linux_bus_finish:
int metal_bus_find(const char *name, struct metal_bus **result)
{
	struct metal_list *node;
	struct metal_bus *bus;

	metal_list_for_each(&_metal.common.bus_list, node) {
		bus = metal_container_of(node, struct metal_bus, node);
		if (strcmp(bus->name, name) == 0 && result) {
			*result = bus;
			return 0;
		}
	}
	return -ENOENT;
}
...
int metal_bus_unregister(struct metal_bus *bus)
{
	metal_list_del(&bus->node);
	if (bus->ops.bus_close)
		bus->ops.bus_close(bus);
	metal_log(METAL_LOG_DEBUG, "unregistered %s bus\n", bus->name);
	return 0;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
void metal_linux_bus_finish(void)
{
	struct linux_bus *lbus;
	struct metal_bus *bus;

	for_each_linux_bus(lbus) {
		if (metal_bus_find(lbus->bus_name, &bus) == 0)
			metal_bus_unregister(bus);
	}
}
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation in the shown code. metal_linux_bus_finish calls metal_bus_find and metal_bus_unregister; the provided definitions of those functions do not call metal_linux_bus_finish. However, a violation could occur if the bus_close callback invoked by metal_bus_unregister (bus->ops.bus_close) were assigned to metal_linux_bus_finish (or to a function chain that eventually calls metal_linux_bus_finish), because then the call chain would be: metal_linux_bus_finish -> metal_bus_unregister -> bus->ops.bus_close -> metal_linux_bus_finish (indirect recursion).
